item.description: Shiny app to analyse Al2O3:C measurements

item.description: Practice some techniques for analysing archaeological radiocabon ages using R

item.title: BayLum
item.description: An R package for chronological Bayesian models integrated for Optically Stimulated OSL, Luminescence Dating

item.title: Bchron
item.description: Radiocarbon Dating, Age-Depth Modelling, Relative Sea Level Rate Estimation, and Non-Parametric Phase Modelling

item.title: calibrator
item.description: Small command line tool for 14C calibration

item.title: carbon14
item.description: The goal of carbon14 is to provide a tidy interface to radiocarbon dating, to promote its inclusion in reproducible manuscripts

item.title: CloudCal
item.description: This app will allow you to build & apply calibrations for the Tracer & Artax series of XRF devices

item.title: clustering_14C
item.description: A python implementation of the method of clustering radiocarbon dates in order to determine whether they represent separate events, or phases in time

item.description: Dose Rate Estimation from In-Situ Gamma-Ray Spectrometry Measurements for Luminescence Dating

item.title: DRAC-calculator
item.description: DRAC is a Dose Rate and Age Calculator which has been designed to calculate environmental dose rates (_) and ages for trapped charge dating applications

item.title: IOSACal
item.description: IOSACal is an open source tool for radiocarbon calibration

item.title: Luminescence
item.description: Development version of the R package ‘Luminescence’. The R package ‘Luminescence’ by the R-Luminescence Group provides a collection of various R functions for luminescence dating data analysis.

item.title: LumReader
item.description: R package to simulate a Luminescence Reader

item.title: magAAR
item.description: Analyse geomagnetic data from archaeological context

item.description: Analytical Dashboard for conducting various analysis to group and assess groupings for Neutron Activation Analytical chemical compositional data

item.title: paleoxrf
item.description: The goal of paleoxrf is to simplify reading data from Acadia’s paleoenvironmental X-Ray Fluorescence laboratory

item.title: PyXRF
item.description: PyXRF is a python-based sophisticated fluorescence analysis package for fitting and visualizing X-ray fluorescence data

item.title: radon
item.description: Backend for one of the largest 14C-Database online.

item.title: Rcarb
item.description: The R package ‘RCarb’ provides a collection of various R functions to model dose rates in carbonate-rich samples. The package is a translation of the ‘MATLAB’ program Carb by Roger P. Nathan

item.title: rcarbon
item.description: Methods for calibrating and analysing radiocarbon dates

item.title: RGPR
item.description: RGPR is a free and open-source software package to read, export, analyse, process and visualise ground-penetrating radar (GPR) data

item.description: Solving Ordinary Differential Equations to Understand Luminescence

item.title: Tldating

item.title: xraylib
item.description: xraylib is a library containing over 40 functions to be used to retrieve data from some of the most respected databases of physical data in the field of X-ray

item.title: xrf
item.description: The goal of xrf is to provide tools to read, plot, and interpret X-Ray fluorescence spectra

item.title: xylib
item.description: ylib is a portable library for reading files with x-y data from powder diffraction, spectroscopy, or other experimental methods
